channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing 'sees third professional dancer refuse Covid vaccine'
item.description: Sources claim the star has already been paired with a celebrity and it is well-known among the cast that they have refused the jab, sparking resentment behind the scenes.

item.title: Prince William says the Duke used to get into 'lots of trouble' with the Queen
item.description: Duke of Sussex is taking part in Prince Philip: The Royal Family Remembers, which is set to air on Wednesday at 9pm in his first 'family project' since quitting royal duties.

item.title: Chelsea leaves it late... I love it! Pumpkins, ripe fruit, VERY bizarre spectacles - ROBERT HARDMAN
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: This year's event is not so much blooming marvellous as drop dead gorgeous. Indeed, one or two of these trees may have dropped the lot by the end of the week.

item.title: Can instant noodle pots really count as one of your five-a-day?
item.description: The humble instant noodle pot is now undergoing something of a healthy makeover - so could it be considered a virtuous choice?Â

item.title: Boris Johnson urges GPs to offer more in-person consultations with patients
item.description: A day after the Mail launched a campaign to improve access to family doctors, Downing Street said that every patient should be able to see their GP if they want an in-person consultation.

item.title: La Palma volcano: 500 tourists among 5,500 evacuated as lava swallows homes
item.description: Lava spewing from Mount Cumbre Vieja on the Spanish island of La Palma entered the town of Los Llanos de Aridane today, where it swallowed homes and set light to nearby buildings.

item.title: The monthly drug that stopped MP Rachel's devastating migraines
item.description: Over the past six years, Home Office minister Rachel Maclean has had such devastating migraines that, at times, she's had to rush out of parliamentary debates to be sick.

item.title: Mother says she was kicked out of a restaurant for breastfeeding her three-day-old son
item.description: Ruby Meeden and her husband Aaron were meeting relatives at Greek Islands Restaurant in Anacortes, Washington, when her newborn, Rhett, got hungry.

item.title: Shattering proof my life really is a Carr crash: Jimmy Carr's brilliant confessional memoirÂ
item.description: JIMMY CARR: If I can still recognise my son and remember anything else 25 years from now, the wisdom I pass on will come from stand-up comedy. It taught me all the skills I needed for life.

item.title: This chamber helps divers beat the bends... and it could stop dementia and cancerÂ
item.description: Research this month suggests that hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBOT), as it is medically known, could be a treatment for dementia.

item.title: Strictly launch's viewing figures are attributed to lacklustre line-up
item.description: The BBC show attracted 7.2 million viewers for the inaugural show over the weekend, and while those numbers remain broadly impressive, they represent a significant drop from last year's 8.6 million.

item.title: Claire Foy proves diamonds are a girl's best friend for British Vogue x Tiffany's party at LFW
item.description: Claire Foy has proved that diamonds really are a girl's best friend as she dressed head-to-toe in sparklers for the British Vogue X Tiffany & Co. party on Monday.

item.title: Kwasi Kwarteng goes full Fonzie in gas crisis
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: That smooth operator Kwasi Kwarteng assures us that everything's fine and there's no need to worry about all this talk of gas shortages this winter.

item.title: New photo of Justin Trudeau in blackface at Arabian Nights party emerges
item.description: The photo shows the liberal icon in a turban and robe, with his tongue sticking out. The world leader has also covered his face with dark makeup.

item.title: Biden arrives in New York for United Nations General Assembly meeting
item.description: President Joe Biden arrived Monday evening in New York City,Â where he'll appear before the United Nations General Assembly for the first time as president.

item.title: Power mad: This devastating audit lays bare the costly errorsÂ
item.description: Had it not been so exceptionally calm in the run up to this autumn equinox, one could call the energy crisis a perfect storm.

item.title: Boris Johnson tells Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro to get some AstraZeneca in him
item.description: Boris Johnson urged Brazil's anti-vaxxer President Jair Bolsonaro to get the AstraZeneca vaccine during a meeting at the British Consulate General's residence in New York on Monday.

item.title: Married at First sight: Morag Crichton brands Joshua Christie a 'f***** liar'
item.description: The show descended into a screaming match with dozens of the contestants leaving the final dinner after reading anonymous letters and a lot of friction at the table.

item.title: Idris Elba looks dapper in a brown suit while his wife Sabrina wows in a red gown at Vogue party
item.description: Idris Elba looked dapper in a brown suit while his stunning wife Sabrina wowed in an unmissable red gown as they cosied up at a British Vogue party on Monday.

item.title: English football pressuring Government to deliver Online Harms Bill amid fears of delay
item.description: The Government will come under pressure from English football's key stakeholders to ensure that no delays in finally introducing the Online Harms Bill are created by the Cabinet reshuffle.

item.title: Emma Raducanu, 18,Â wows in a white outfit as she attendsÂ London Fashion Week eventÂ
item.description: Emma Raducanu, 18, appeared in high spirits as she walked the black carpet at the intimate dinner and partyÂ hosted by British Vogue and Tiffany & Co. in London.

item.title: Fresh meat supply will be slashed within days as energy crisis hits supply chainÂ
item.description: Chicken and pork could vanish from supermarket shelves as the energy crisis hits key elements of the supply chain, while the number of Christmas turkeys available is set to be down drastically

item.title: R Kelly prosecution case rests: Defense calls mentee who knew singer for 15 years and felon ex-cop
item.description: Prosecutors rested their case against R. Kelly Monday morning, after 20 days of testimony from accusers - and now two witnesses have come to the singer's defense.

item.title: Biden supports 'thorough' investigation of drone strike that killed 10 Afghan civiliansÂ
item.description: President Joe Biden wants a 'thorough' investigation of the US drone strike that killed 10 Afghans and seven children in the final days of the US withdrawal last month.

item.title: Devastated father of two children found dead in house in Derbyshire pays tribute
item.description: The parents of two 11-year-old schoolgirls who were killed alongside one of the child's mother and brother during a sleepoverÂ have paid heartbreaking tributes.

item.title: Boris Johnson dampens hope of signing US trade agreement any time soon
item.description: Speaking ahead of his first White House summit today, Mr Johnson said a number of longstanding trade issues had been resolved, such as tariffs on Scotch whisky and the ban on British beef.

item.title: Man who videotaped brutal beating of Rodney King by LA cops is killed by COVID
item.description: George Holliday, aged 61, died on Sunday at a hospital in Simi Valley, California, after battling COVID since mid August, TMZ reported.

item.title: Shoppers rave about this Â£4 scalp massaging brush from Amazon for treating dandruff
item.description: Looking for ways to get a healthy scalp? Amazon shoppers say this massaging scalp brush can help reset the scalp of flakes and product build-up for your healthiest hair yet. And it costs Â£3.99.

item.title: Idris and Sabrina Elba cosy up ahead of the British Vogue x Tiffany & Co. Fashion and Film party
item.description: Sabrina Elba was her husband Idris' lady in red as the pair cosied up ahead of the British Vogue x Tiffany & Co. fashion and film party in London on Monday.

item.title: Prince Andrew 'stays at Balmoral despite daughter Beatrice giving birth
item.description: The news, which comes only seven months after younger daughter Eugenie gave birth to her son August, has already been welcomed by Sarah, Duchess of York.

item.title: Pictured: Woman, 28, found dead in park near community centre in Greenwich
item.description: Police believe a stranger may have targeted school teacher Sabina Nessa, 28, before dumping her body in Cator Park, Greenwich, south-east London.

item.title: Elon Musk mocks Joe Biden on being asked why president hasn't congratulated SpaceX mission
item.description: When the billionaire and SpaceX founder was asked on Twitter why he thoughtÂ Biden hadn't commended him, he responded: Â 'He's still sleeping.'

item.title: Schools must never shut down again in future Covid lockdowns, watchdog warnsÂ
item.description: Dame Rachel de Souza warned the new UK Education Secretary Nadhim Zahawi: 'The harms done of losing education are immense.'

item.title: Diseases that could be helped by nerve zapper technology
item.description: The treatment involves gently stimulating a major nerve that runs through the body using an electric current so mild that in most people it causes just a slight tingling sensation.

item.title: Prince who's sparked at panic at the palace: The legal vice tightens for the Duke of YorkÂ
item.description: Once, it would have been an excuse for a party, one of those lavish, themed affairs so common at Royal Lodge, where even the staff were required to put on fancy dress.

item.title: MARKET REPORT: Centrica heats up as it takes on new customers
item.description: The firm was one of the top risers in the FTSE 250, up 4.6 per cent, or 2.3p, at 53p as it said it will be taking on the former customers of People's Energy, a smaller provider that collapsed last week.

item.title: ALISON BOSHOFF on why, for the new Â£213m power couple, Adele's greatest hit could not be more apt
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: TheyÂ are Hollywood's hottest and newest power couple - worth more than Â£200 million between them and living in separate Beverly Hills mansions a stone's throw apart.

item.title: Researchers find 3,600 year-old evidence that Tall el-Hammam was destroyed by a 'cosmic airburst'
item.description: Researchers have unearthed 3,600-year-old evidence that Tall el-Hammam was destroyed by a 'cosmic impact' and may have inspired Bible story of destruction of Sodom.

item.title: Madeleine McCann's GP mother Kate returns to work on NHS frontline to help fight Covid pandemicÂ
item.description: Kate, who was working as a GP when Madeleine disappeared on holiday in Portugal in 2007, has re-joined the NHS frontline in the fight against Coronavirus in Leicester hospitals.

item.title: Police slammed for letting 'person of interest' slip away after likely remains of Gabby Petito found
item.description: FBI agents stormed the North Port, Florida home of 'person of interest' Brian Laundrie's parents on Monday - a day after authorities found the body likely to be that of Gabby Petito in Wyoming.

item.title: Peter Thiel said Zuckerberg agreed with Trump to push 'state-sanctioned conservatism,' new book says
item.description: Max Chafkin's new book 'The Contrarian: Peter Thiel and Silicon Valley's Pursuit of Power,' writes that Thiel attended the meeting then told an associate of the alleged deal between Zuckerberg and Donald Trump.

item.title: PM welcomes US decision to ease travel rules on double-jabbed Brits
item.description: Bookings surged by more than 90 per cent within an hour of the US President's announcement and airlines' share prices rocketed.

item.title: Sophie Wessex joins Gemma Collins, Guy Ritchie and Judi Dench at Chelsea Flower Show
item.description: The Queen , who attends the event every year, skipped it this year for the first time since 2005 as she remains in Balmoral, where she is expected to stay until October.

item.title: Covid on verge of killing more Americans than Spanish flu: Number of deaths edges towards 674,000
item.description: There were an estimated 642 Spanish flu deaths per 100,000 people because the U.S. population sat at 105 million compared to 204 Covid deaths per 100,000 Americans with a population of 330 million.

item.title: Made In Chelsea series 22 FIRST LOOK: Ollie Locke breaks down as surrogacy plans hit a wall
item.description: The new series of Made In Chelsea is set to return in the coming weeks, with a first look trailer teasing what's to come.

item.title: FDA approved gout medicine - Probenecid - shows promise fighting viruses like COVID-19
item.description: Probenecid, a drug used to treat gout, has shown anti-viral capabilities, a study from the University of Georgia finds. It is among a variety of drugs being tested to treat COVID-19.

item.title: Princess Beatrice gives birth
item.description: Princess Beatrice gave birth to a baby girl at 11.42pm on Saturday at the Chelsea and Westminster Hospital in London, Buckingham Palace has announced.

item.title: Iceland boss warns C02 shortage will hit food supplies 'within DAYS'
item.description: CO2 is used in the UK to stun animals for slaughter, package meat and also in refrigeration systems. It is also used in fizzy drinks, beer, cheese, fruit and vegetables and crumpets, among other items.

item.title: Desperate Haitians are paying up to $10,000 and traveling up to thousands of miles to cross into US
item.description: There has been a surge in Haitians traveling to the U.S. as a result of a perfect storm caused by the coronavirus pandemic, a devastating earthquake in Haiti last month and political instability.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein pleads not guilty - again - to sexual assault charge in Los Angeles
item.description: Disgraced film producer Harvey Weinstein (shown in a court sketch) appeared in a Los Angeles courtroom Monday, where he pleaded not guilty for a second time to a sexual assault charge.

item.title: Calling women 'birds' is 'plainly sexist', judge rules
item.description: The ruling came in the case of a Barclays investment banker who won a sex discrimination claim after her boss repeatedly called women 'birds'.

item.title: 'Vampire' catfish which can swim up man's urethra use larger host fish as Amazon water taxis
item.description: A new study suggests that vampire fish, also known as candiru, attach themselves to a larger host to navigate the difficult waters of the Amazon river.

item.title: Cruel trolls mock McDonald's superfan after she won free meals for a year
item.description: Connie Bulloch, 24, from Hamilton, South Lanarkshire, has been mocked by trolls on social media who made fun of her weight andÂ suggested she needed a break from fast food.

item.title: Newly tarmacked Peak District lane Bamford Clough is named 'the steepest climb in Britain'
item.description: Intrepid hill-climb specialist Simon Warren tried to cycle up Bamford Clough in the Peak District, but was defeated, tweeting 'there is no way on earth I can ride up that'.

item.title: SpaceX's Inspiration4 crew detail 'emotional' mission in first interview since returning to EarthÂ
item.description: In their first interview since returning to Earth, the all-civilian crew of SpaceX's Inspiration4 mission said on Monday that their the trip to space was 'awe-inspiring' and 'emotional.'

item.title: Amy Winehouse's wardrobe from her 2011 tour is expected to fetch Â£36,000 at auction
item.description: The star, known for hits including Back To Black and Rehab, died of alcohol poisoning on July 23, 2011, just a month after her tour was cancelled following just one performance.

item.title: Identical twin sisters dating identical twin brothers all LIVE together and share 75% of their dates
item.description: Venessa and Kerissa D'Arpino, 25, from Medford, Oregon met brothers Lucas and Jacob Sealby, 29, in June of 2020. They do everything together but won't have a double wedding.

item.title: Police drop investigation into claims a woman was dragged into an Oxfordshire churchyard and raped
item.description: Extensive searches of the area and a 'thorough examination' of CCTV footage was undertaken by investigators after a woman in her twenties reported being raped in Witney on Sunday.

item.title: Wetherspoons is slashing price of all food and drink by 7.5% on Thursday
item.description: Wetherspoons is to slash the prices of food and drinks in its 870 pubs across the UK by 7.5 per cent on September 23 to mark Tax Equality Day.

item.title: TOWIE star Lewis Bloor 'was part of plot to defraud more than 200 elderly investors'
item.description: More than 200 UK victims, many of whom were elderly, were allegedly conned into buying the small, coloured stones as an investment after being 'told lies' during cold calls.

item.title: Mars is 'too small' to retain liquid water, according to a new study
item.description: About half the size of Earth, Mars is the second smallest planet in the solar system, sitting at the very outer edge of the habitable zone where liquid water 'could flow'.

item.title: Stroke victims recover best if rehab starts 2-3 MONTHS after the event
item.description: Researchers from the Georgetown University Medical Center worked with 72 volunteers who suffered a stroke within three weeks of the trial.

item.title: Is your energy firm about to go bust and what can you do about it?
item.description: The crisis is expected to hit millions of Britons after wholesale energy prices went from a record low last May because of a lack of demand due to lockdowns to the highest rates since the 1990s.

item.title: Police called to FIVE bomb threats just hours apart
item.description: Pupils from Spalding High School, St John the Baptist Primary and Monkshouse Primary in Lincoln were evacuated after reports alleging bombs were on the premises.

item.title: NHS scientist who swapped price tags of expensive products for cheaper ones is suspended
item.description: Maureen Bennie, a scientist at Greater Glasgow and Clyde NHS, admitted misconduct and was suspended her from the profession for a year.

item.title: Jodie Whittaker mans the Tardis in Cardiff for her final instalments in Doctor Who
item.description: Jodie Whittaker manned the Tardis for her final instalments in Doctor Who on Monday as the iconic time machine took a trip to Cardiff for filming

item.title: Teenage rugby player is killed just hours before his 18th birthday in suspected hit and runÂ
item.description: Dylan Price, 17, was found in a Shropshire country lane just hours before he would have been celebrating his milestone birthday.

item.title: Greggs launches its Autumn Menu for 2021 including vegan bacon roll
item.description: The chain, who caused a sensation when they launched the vegan sausage roll in 2019, have now added two new plant-based treats on the menu across the UK.

item.title: Mastermind behind Osama bin Laden's escape from US bombing of Tora Bora is back in charge of Taliban
item.description: Anwar ul Haq Mujahid is leading a command of hundreds of Taliban fighters in Afghanistan. His command is joined by others who helped al Qaeda in 2001.

item.title: 'Disgraceful' anaesthetist, 61, who almost killed his girlfriend is jailed for 14-and-a-half-years
item.description: Dr Hossam Metwally, 61, who worked at Diana Princess of Wales Hospital in Grimsby, North-east Lincolnshire, left his girlfriend Kelly Wilson close to death with multiple organ failure after.

item.title: Mother-of-four who was 'unmasked, unmuzzled, and unvaccainated' dies of COVID-19 at age 40
item.description: Kristen Lowery, 40, from Escalon, California, died on September 15th. She leaves behind four school-age children. She had been outspoken against vaccines and masks.

item.title: Boris Johnson slams major countries for lack of climate change action
item.description: Boris Johnson today lashed out at the world's leading economic nations as he accused them of doing 'nowhere near enough' to tackle climate change.

item.title: Property developer has Â£300K fine cut to Â£100K on appeal
item.description: Fiorenzo Sauro, 49, who is the director of Enzo Homes Ltd, paid for 70 protected trees to be felled at a site in Penllergaer Estate, Swansea, south Wales.

item.title: Chinese academic warns Australia will be a target for NUCLEAR WAR after AUSUK submarine deal
item.description: China's tantrum over Australia's nuclear submarine deal has continued with a Beijing bureaucrat threatening Australia is now a target for nuclear war.

item.title: Motorist, 56, banned after footage showed him hitting parked car while three times over legal limitÂ
item.description: The footage shows David Leary, 56, knocking down a street sign, mounting kerbs, veering onto the wrong side of the road and colliding with a parked car, while driving at three times over the legal limit.

item.title: Eco-mob 'profoundly apologise' for blockading M25
item.description: Insulate Britain,Â the group who blocked the M25 for the fourth time in a week, wrote to Priti Patel in an effort to begin an 'open dialogue' and plead with her to 'demonstrate leadership'.

item.title: Winner of Bristol half Marathon disqualified after running wrong race
item.description: Omar Ahmed (pictured), from Birmingham,Â he winner of the 2021 Bristol Half Marathon has been disqualified after he ran the wrong race.

item.title: Risky bidding? Porsche 928 from Risky Business sells for world record $1.98m
item.description: Hagerty, which specialises in valuing collectible motor cars, says a 'concours' (meaning it is in such a condition it could be displayed in a museum) 928 today is worth an average of Â£30,600.

item.title: Hungarian female jockey, 21, dies after horror mid-race fallÂ
item.description: Eszter Jeles, who once urged her followers not to be sad if she died while riding, passed away in hospital in the Turkish city of Istanbul on Saturday, September 18.

item.title: End of working from home 'fuelled England's third Covid wave'
item.description: The Office for National Statistics (ONS) found that case rates this summer were highest among office workers, bankers, teachers and other professions.

item.title: DAN WOOTTON: Forget what your woke world leader chums say, Boris
item.description: DAN WOOTTON: It's hard to believe I'm writing this in 2021 but Britain's lights are close to going out. Literally. Our food supplies are in doubt for Christmas.

item.title: Couple shares photo of rescue dog that people say resembles Samuel L JacksonÂ
item.description: Social media users say Dr Handsome makes the same facial expression as Jackson, one even attributing the similarities to the pup's toothy smile. They also say the pup is very human-like.

item.title: Melanie Sykes, 51, joined by gondolier beau Riccardo Simionato, 24, in London on romantic stroll
item.description: The TV presenter, 51, and her 24-year-old beau were seen on a romantic stroll on Sunday, following Riccardo's arrival to the UK, and only had eyes for each other as they hugged and walked hand-in-hand.Â

item.title: Ancient Mars was dotted with thousands of massive super volcanoes, NASA says
item.description: Researchers at NASA have confirmed that Mars previously experienced 'super eruptions' in its past, with the blasts happening over a 500-million-year-period about 4 billion years ago.

item.title: Florist finalise their colourful displays at the Chelsea Flower Show as it returns
item.description: The Chelsea Flower Show is preparing to open its doors to the pubic tomorrow as it returns for a one-off Autumn edition this week from tomorrow until Sunday 26 September.

item.title: Holly Willoughby launches lifestyle website to share her favourite products with fans
item.description: TV presenter Holly Willoughby, 40, has followed in the footsteps of Gwyneth Paltrow by launching her own lifestyle website to share her favourite products with fans.

item.title: Friday actor Anthony Johnson has died at age 55
item.description: His nephew told TMZ that Anthony had been found passed out in a Los Angeles store earlier this month. He was rushed to the hospital where he was pronounced dead.

item.title: T-shaped electricity pylons are being installed over 35-mile stretch from Hinkley Point
item.description: The National Grid's new 'T-pylon' design is being rolled out on a 35-mile route carrying low-carbon electricity from Hinkley Point C Nuclear power station in Somerset to Avonmouth, Bristol.

item.title: Asking price on average British home hits a record high of Â£338,462
item.description: Average asking prices for homes across Britain increased by 0.3 per cent, or Â£1,091, month-on-month in September, according to figures from Rightmove.

item.title: New body launched to self-regulate Covid testing amid No10's crackdown on 'exploitative' firms
item.description: A new industry body, The Laboratory and Testing Industry Organisation has promised to create a 'trustworthy' list of companies Britons can rely on forÂ accurate, timely and fairly priced tests.

item.title: PM rules out more jabs for developing world until boosters done
item.description: Britain will not donate more vaccine doses to the developing world until the UK's booster programme is completed, Boris Johnson said last night.

item.title: Prince Charles says Prince Philip was 'marvellous at arranging silly games'
item.description: In a BBC tribute programme to Prince Philip, airing on Wednesday, Prince Charles, 72, says 'there were lots of chasing around and mad things' when he was a child.

item.title: Two women are sexually assaulted by 'fake taxi driver' who picked them up outside London nightclub
item.description: The pair got into a car they believed to be a vehicle they pre-booked before leaving the club. They became suspicious when the driver travelled in the opposite direction before offering them a drink.

item.title: The NEW Winter of Discontent thanks to high gas prices and lorry driver shortage
item.description: The price of wholesale gas has surged by 250% since the beginning of the year and added 70% just since August as demand increases while the UK economy opens up.

item.title: Jailed Italian mobster holds prison guard at gunpoint using weapon delivered by DRONEÂ
item.description: The 28-year-old prisoner, who has links to the Neapolitan mafia, fired three shots on Sunday at prisoners he had argued with after being unable to open their cells with keys he forced from a guard.

item.title: Early signs of autism can be reversed if babies are offered therapy to help their social development
item.description: A video therapy cut the chance of three-year-olds being diagnosed with autism by two-thirds, researchers atÂ the University of Western Australia and University of Manchester found.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton to join Prince Charles and Camilla at No Time To Die premiere
item.description: In a rare joint engagement, Prince William, Kate, both 39, Camilla, 74, and Prince Charles, 72, will step out on to the red carpet atÂ the Royal Albert Hall in London on Tuesday to meet 007 star Daniel Craig.

item.title: Would YOU pay Â£50,000 for a BBQ? Guy Ritchie debuts 'fire table' at Chelsea Flower ShowÂ
item.description: Director Guy Ritchie, 53, designed the outdoor grill to entertain celebrity guests like The Beckhams all year round at his Ashcombe House estate, near Salisbury.

item.title: Pfizer says its Covid vaccine is safe for children over the age of FIVE as it pushes for approval
item.description: Fourteen-year-old Jack Lane became one of the first to benefit from the extension of Britain's jab rollout today. He received his vaccination at Belfairs Academy in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex

item.title: Man arrested on suspicion of 'punching' Katie Price at home is re-bailed
item.description: The 32-year-old suspect was held after the reality star, 42, was allegedly punched in the face at her home in Essex last month.

item.title: Two sisters have become the world's oldest identical twins just 15 days shy of their 108th birthdayÂ
item.description: Umeno Sumiyama and Koume Kodama are 107 years and 330 days old. The sisters were born the third and fourth of 11 children on Shodoshima island, western Japan, in 1913.

item.title: Former Home and Away child star Felix Dean in jail charged with assault and attempted robbery
item.description: Felix Dean was just 10 when he got his big break on the show, acting alongside Ada Nicodemou as her on-screen son VJ Patterson from 2007 to 2014.

item.title: 'Lorry drivers will be allowed to drive for up to 11 hours a DAY to stave off delivery crisis
item.description: Ministers are believed to be discussing easing the current rules around driving HGVs in the UK until the end of January.

item.title: Police launch hunt for two 11-year-old boys after they failed to turn up to school
item.description: The boys, named Logan and Alfie, were last seen at their homes in Cirencester at 8am when they left for school but failed to turn up to class.

item.title: David Beckham's son Romeo makes professional football debut for Inter Miami's reserve team
item.description: The 19-year-old second son of former Manchester United and England star David Beckham made his professional football debut for American third-tier side Fort Lauderdale on Sunday.

item.title: Julia Bradbury, 51, breaks down in tears after breast cancer diagnosis
item.description: Appearing on Woman's Hour on Monday, the Countryfile presenter, 51, broke down in tears as she spoke of her upcoming mastectomy following her breast cancer diagnosis.

item.title: This rosacea makeup product covers redness in minutes - and it's on sale with 20% off on Amazon
item.description: If you find your skin flaring up with redness and flushing, Amazon shoppers recommend the Rosalique 3 in 1 Anti-Redness Miracle Formula SPF50 makeup base for covering redness and...

item.title: Beauty therapist, 20, denies sexually assaulting man by slapping bottom in front of his girlfriend
item.description: A beauty therapist today denied sexually assaulting a man by slapping his bottom on a night out in Portsmouth

item.title: Half of workers 'would quit if they had to go back to the office five days a week'
item.description: A study indicated that towns and villages across the UK could see a major financial boost thanks to the growth of hybrid working because of the pandemic.

item.title: James Middleton's bride Alizee reveals she wore her mother-in-law Carole's wedding dress
item.description: Speaking to Hello!, the financialÂ analyst, 32, said she borrowed the gown, which was donned by the Duchess of Cambridge's mother in 1980 during her nuptials to Michael, after falling 'in love with it'.

item.title: Amateur chefs share their WORST ever cooking fails
item.description: These photos of kitchen horrors, shared by Bored Panda and taken by amateur chefs across the globe, reveal some of the worst dishes you are ever likely to lay your eyes on.

item.title: Teenage pregnancies plunged by a THIRD in a year during first lockdown
item.description: A total of 2,600 children aged between 15 and 17 fell pregnant between March and June 2020 in England and Wales, according to the Office for National Statistics.

item.title: Hermes driver claims attempted delivery of parcel by sharing a photo of himself watching TV
item.description: Thomas Gent, 30, was shocked when he received an email notification on Thursday as he was waiting for his parcel of craft materials to arrive at his home in Preston, Lancashire.

item.title: Men sleep worse during the first half of the lunar cycle, study finds
item.description: Men's sleep may be more powerfully influenced by the lunar cycle than women's, report researchers at Uppsala University in Sweden.

item.title: Charlie Webster details horrific abuse she faced at the hands of her running coach
item.description: In new BBC documentaryÂ Nowhere to Run: Abused by Our Coach, Charlie Webster detailed the first time her athletics coach, Paul North, assaulted her at the age of 15.

item.title: Barely-driven 1993 Jaguar XJ220 sells for record Â£460k at auction
item.description: The price paid for the 'good as new' car is a world record sum at auction for an XJ220. However, it's less than what the first owner paid in 1993 before it was put into controlled storage.

item.title: Broadcaster slammed for 'objectification' in coverage of female sport climbing event
item.description: The International Federation of Sport Climbing issued a statementÂ condemning the 'objectification of the human body' in relation to clips shown of climber Johanna Farber.

item.title: Google sends broadband across the Congo River via beams of light
item.description: Project Taara is being carried out by X, Alphabet's secretive R&D branch based in Mountain View, California.

item.title: Lily Allen is SLAMMED for publicly shaming takeaway pizza company
item.description: The singer, 36, took to her Story on Sunday night to share a snap of the meal writing in the caption: 'Not impressed tbh' before tagging the brand Pizza Pilgrims.

item.title: Carson Shephard: Boy, 7, who went missing from New Cumnock is found in grandmother's loft
item.description: Officers launched a desperate hunt for missing Carson Shephard, 7, after he vanished in New Cumnock, East Ayrshire, on Sunday evening. Now his mother has revealed he was hiding in the loft.

item.title: Raheem Sterling's former agent Aidy Ward 'broke FA rules by signing under-age players'
item.description: The investigation into Ward also revealed an incident where he had asked Raheem Sterling to speak to a 15-year-old boy in a bid to attract the young player to his agency.

item.title: Advert for Lounge Underwear bra leaves social media users in stitches
item.description: An advert for a Lounge Underwear bra has left social media users in stitches after Jennifer, from the UK, admitted she thought the model had 'one giant t*t' due to a close-up showing the lace.

item.title: Fury as NHS staff are offered training on BLM as part of new diversity courses on 'white privilege'
item.description: Training covering 'white privilege' and 'unconscious bias' have been put up on NHS People website - an online learning portal for the service's staff - reports the Telegraph.

item.title: Transgender Turkish doctor struck off for 'offending public morality' with bikini pictures
item.description: Larin Kayatas claims the decision to dismiss her was purely political and an attempt to discourage members of the country's LGBTQ+ community from pursuing careers in medicine.

item.title: This Mrs Hinch-approved Shark steam mop that sanitises dirty floors in minutes is now under Â£99
item.description: If you want to clean dirty floors in minutes, Amazon has a great deal for you, as today the bestselling Shark Smartronic Deluxe Klik N' Flip Steam Mop is on sale for under Â£99 -that's the lowest price...

item.title: A swarm of honey bees had killed 63 endangered penguins in South Africa by stinging them in the EYES
item.description: Government officials and a nonprofit organisation said the dead penguins were found inÂ Simon's Town, around 25 miles from Cape Town, city on Friday morning, each with multiple stings.

item.title: Campaigners criticise Nicola Sturgeon's gender reform plans
item.description: The Scottish Government has said it intends to bring forward the Gender Recognition Reform (Scotland) Bill within the next year.

item.title: French author writes about having an incestuous relationship with her abusive father at 26
item.description: French author Christine Angot, 62, revealed in her new book Le Voyage Dans L'Est that she and her abusive father resumed their incestuous relationship when she was 26.

item.title: BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood is dragged to the floor by a guide dog
item.description: The Scottish weather presenter, 59, ended up being taken out by the excitable hound leaving her co-presenter Dan Walker in hysterics back in the studio.

item.title: Sarah Jessica Parker shares a kiss with Chris Noth in FIRST footage of the Sex and the City reboot
item.description: Sarah Jessica Parker and Chris Noth share a kiss as they slow dance at home in highly-anticipated Sex and the City reboot.

item.title: Two married police officers IGNORED call-outs to an assault and burglary to have sex in squad car
item.description: Surrey Police officers Sgt Molly Edwards and her lover PC Richard Paton's affair was exposed after bosses bugged the vehicle and recorded moaning and 'verbal expressions of sexual fantasies'.

item.title: How I swapped the catwalk for horti-couture
item.description: I was one of the pioneers of the tulle skirt with heavy boots, as well as taking colour blocking. But since the pandemic my new favourite thing to dress is my little courtyard.
